text: Maria Magnólia de Souza Figueiredo (born 11 November 1963 in Currais Novos, Rio Grande do NorteSports-Reference profile) is a retired Brazilian athlete who competed in the 400 and 800 metres. She represented her country at the 1988 and 1996 Summer Olympics, as well as four World Championships. She has personal bests of 22.99 in the 200 metres (1988) and 50.62 in the 400 metres (1990). The latter is the current national record.
